title: "How Did Mystics and Positivists Misunderstand Each Other? And What about the Negative Effects of Tobacco?"
first_phrase: This text discusses the negative effects of tobacco abuse on the brain and the importance of controlling scientific experiments. The author, Victor Meunier, shares his belief that mystics who believed in the power of suggestion and positivists who denied it were both mistaken. He refers to the experiences of Charmes, the hospital in La Rochelle, and the Asylum of Lafont near Rochefort, as evidence. The text also mentions Dr. Depierris, who offers prizes for the best theses on the effects of smoking on health and literature.
